snippet: A proposal that would force Apple to negotiate with publishers one at a time is an attempt to prevent the company and big publishers from collusion.
abstract: Federal Judge Denise L Cote proposes that Apple be required to negotiate future contracts with major publishers separately and at defined intervals as part of its punishment for illegally conspiring to raise prices of e-books.
lead_paragraph: A proposal that would force Apple to negotiate with publishers one at a time is an attempt to prevent the company and big publishers from collusion.

headline.main: Judge Considers Limits on Apple’s Future E-Book Deals
headline.print_headline: Judge Considers Limits on Apple’s Future E-Book Deals
